de.unlixx.runpng.util

Class ImageUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.unlixx.runpng.util.ImageUtil

  • public class ImageUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Static utility methods to handle bitmaps and image objects.

    • Method Detail

      • getIntARGBColor

        public static int getIntARGBColor(javafx.scene.paint.Color color)
        Converts the values of a Color object into an int value.
        Parameters:
        color - The given Color object.
        Returns:
        An int ARGB value of the color.

      • getColor

        public static javafx.scene.paint.Color getColor(int nA,
                                                int nR,
                                                int nG,
                                                int nB)
        Creates a Color object by the given ARGB integers. All int values must be in the unsigned byte range (0 - 255).
        Parameters:
        nA - An int containing the alpha value.
        nR - An int containing the red part.
        nG - An int containing the green part.
        nB - An int containing the blue part.
        Returns:
        The resulting Color object.

      • getColor

        public static javafx.scene.paint.Color getColor(int nARGB)
        Creates a Color object by a single integer. All four bytes of this int are used in ARGB order.
        Parameters:
        nARGB - An int containing the whole color information.
        Returns:
        The resulting Color object.

      • linearGrey

        public static int linearGrey(int nRGB)
        Creates a greyscale in the range 0 - 255 from the given RGB, where 0 is black and 255 is white. A probably contained alpha value will be ignored.
        Parameters:
        nRGB - An int containing an RGB color information.
        Returns:
        A greyscale value in the range 0 - 255.

      • blendPixel

        public static int blendPixel(int nLower,
                             int nUpper)
        Blends an upper pixel over a given lower pixel according the opacity (alpha) of lower and upper pixel.
        Parameters:
        nLower - An int containing the ARGB color information of the lower pixel.
        nUpper - An int containing the ARGB color information of the upper pixel.
        Returns:
        The resulting ARGB color value.

      • bitmapShiftHorz

        public static Bitmap32 bitmapShiftHorz(Bitmap32 bitmap,
                                       int nCols)
        Shifts a bitmap horizontally by a given column amount. The resulting overflow will be inserted at the other side.
        Parameters:
        bitmap - A Bitmap32 object with content to shift.
        nCols - An int containing the amount of columns to shift. A positive value causes a shift to the right side. A negative value vice versa. If a 0 is given or the shifting is >= the width then the bitmap simply gets copied.
        Returns:
        A new Bitmap32 object, shifted by the given amount of columns.

      • bitmapShiftVert

        public static Bitmap32 bitmapShiftVert(Bitmap32 bitmap,
                                       int nLines)
        Shifts a bitmap vertically by a given line amount. The resulting overflow will be inserted at the other side.
        Parameters:
        bitmap - A Bitmap32 object with content to shift.
        nLines - An int containing the amount of lines to shift. A positive value causes a shift down. A negative value vice versa. If a 0 is given or the shifting is >= the width then the bitmap simply gets copied.
        Returns:
        A new Bitmap32 object, shifted by the given amount of lines.

      • bitmapCropCentered

        public static Bitmap32 bitmapCropCentered(Bitmap32 bitmap,
                                          int nDestWidth,
                                          int nDestHeight,
                                          int nARGBFill)
        Crops a bitmap while keeping it centered. The resulting bitmap will be filled with a given ARGB color before the cropped bitmap is copied over the destination bitmap.
        Parameters:
        bitmap - The source Bitmap32 object to copy and crop.
        nDestWidth - The desired width of the new bitmap.
        nDestHeight - The desired height of the new bitmap.
        nARGBFill - An ARGB color value for the fill before copy operation.
        Returns:
        A new Bitmap32 object, cropped to the given dimensions and filled where needed.

      • imageScaleAsymmetrical

        public static javafx.scene.image.WritableImage imageScaleAsymmetrical(javafx.scene.image.Image image,
                                                                      double dDestWidth,
                                                                      double dDestHeight)
        Creates an asymmetrically scaled image by the given width and height.
        Parameters:
        image - The source image object.
        dDestWidth - The desired width of the new image.
        dDestHeight - The desired height of the new image.
        Returns:
        A new scaled image object with the desired dimensions.

      • imageScaleCentered

        public static javafx.scene.image.Image imageScaleCentered(javafx.scene.image.Image image,
                                                          double dDestWidth,
                                                          double dDestHeight,
                                                          ImageUtil.SCALEMODE scaleMode,
                                                          boolean bSym)
        Scales an image symmetrically or asymetrically to the given dimensions while keeping it centered.
        Parameters:
        image - The source image object.
        dDestWidth - The desired width of the new image.
        dDestHeight - The desired height of the new image.
        scaleMode - A mode which direction to scale
        bSym - If true then the aspect ratio will be preserved while scaling.
        Returns:
        A new scaled image object with the desired dimensions.

      • imageCropCentered

        public static javafx.scene.image.Image imageCropCentered(javafx.scene.image.Image image,
                                                         double dDestWidth,
                                                         double dDestHeight)
        Crops an image while keeping it centered. The resulting image will be filled with transparency if the new dimensions are greater than the source image.
        Parameters:
        image - The source image to copy and crop.
        dDestWidth - The desired width of the new image.
        dDestHeight - The desired height of the new image.
        Returns:
        A new Image object, cropped to the given dimensions and filled where needed.

      • blendColorOver

        protected static void blendColorOver(int[] anPixels,
                                     javafx.scene.paint.Color color)
        Blends an ARGB color over a pixel array.
        Parameters:
        anPixels - The ARGB pixel array.
        color - The ARGB color object to blend over.

      • blend

        protected static void blend(int[] anLower,
                            int[] anUpper)
        Blends an upper pixel array over a given lower pixel array according the opacity (alpha) of lower and upper pixel. The lower pixel array contains the result.
        Parameters:
        anLower - An int array containing the ARGB color information of the lower pixels.
        anUpper - An int array containing the ARGB color information of the upper pixels.

      • blend

        protected static void blend(int[] anLower,
                            int nWidth,
                            int nHeight,
                            int[] anUpper,
                            int nUpperOffsX,
                            int nUpperOffsY,
                            int nUpperWidth,
                            int nUpperHeight)
        Blends an upper pixel array over a given lower pixel array according the opacity (alpha) of lower and upper pixel and according the given positions and dimensions. The lower pixel array contains the result.
        Parameters:
        anLower - An int array containing the ARGB color information of the lower pixels.
        nWidth - The width of the destinated bitmap.
        nHeight - The height of the destinated bitmap.
        anUpper - An int array containing the ARGB color information of the upper pixels.
        nUpperOffsX - The horizontal position of the source bitmap.
        nUpperOffsY - The vertical position of the source bitmap.
        nUpperWidth - The width of the source bitmap.
        nUpperHeight - The height of the source bitmap.

      • imageApplyForeground

        public static javafx.scene.image.Image imageApplyForeground(javafx.scene.image.Image image,
                                                            javafx.scene.paint.Color colorFgnd,
                                                            javafx.scene.image.Image imageFgnd)
        Applies a foreground color and/or a foreground image to a given lower image. If the given foreground image size is not the same like the size of the lower image then the foreground image will be centered.
        Parameters:
        image - The source Image object to apply the foreground to.
        colorFgnd - A Color object or null if not wanted.
        imageFgnd - An Image object or null if not wanted.
        Returns:
        A copy of the given Image object with the foreground applied.

      • imageApplyBackground

        public static javafx.scene.image.Image imageApplyBackground(javafx.scene.image.Image image,
                                                            javafx.scene.paint.Color colorBgnd,
                                                            javafx.scene.image.Image imageBgnd)
        Applies a background color and/or a background image to a given upper image. If the given background image size is not the same like the size of the upper image then the background image will be centered.
        Parameters:
        image - The source Image object to apply the background to.
        colorBgnd - A Color object or null if not wanted.
        imageBgnd - An Image object or null if not wanted.
        Returns:
        A copy of the given Image object with the background applied.

      • mask

        protected static void mask(int[] anPixels,
                           int nWidth,
                           int nHeight,
                           int[] anMask,
                           int nMaskOffsX,
                           int nMaskOffsY,
                           int nMaskWidth,
                           int nMaskHeight,
                           int nBgnd)
        Applies a greyscale mask to a given pixel array. Where full white means opaque and full black means transparent. Values between black and white result in translucent pixels. Colors in the mask will be converted into greyscale. Alpha (opacity) values in the mask or in the background will be ignored.
        Parameters:
        anPixels - The ARGB pixel array.
        nWidth - The supposed width of the bitmap.
        nHeight - The supposed height of the bitmap.
        anMask - An RGB mask pixel array.
        nMaskOffsX - The horizontal offset of the mask.
        nMaskOffsY - The vertical offset of the mask.
        nMaskWidth - The supposed width of the mask.
        nMaskHeight - The supposed height of the mask.
        nBgnd - An RGB background color. Alpha (opacity) values will be ignored.

      • mask

        protected static void mask(int[] anPixels,
                           int nBgnd,
                           int[] anMask)
        Masks a pixel array with a greyscale background and a mask pixel array.
        Parameters:
        anPixels - The ARGB pixel array.
        nBgnd - An RGB background color. Alpha (opacity) values will be ignored.
        anMask - An RGB mask pixel array of the same length like the ARGB pixel array.

      • mask

        protected static void mask(int[] anPixels,
                           int nBgnd)
        Masks a pixel array with a greyscale background.
        Parameters:
        anPixels - The ARGB pixel array.
        nBgnd - An RGB background color. Alpha (opacity) values will be ignored.

      • imageApplyMask

        public static javafx.scene.image.Image imageApplyMask(javafx.scene.image.Image image,
                                                      javafx.scene.paint.Color colorBgnd,
                                                      javafx.scene.image.Image imageMask)
        Applies a greyscale mask to a given image. Where full white means opaque and full black means transparent. Values between black and white result in translucent pixels. Colors in the mask will be converted into greyscale. Alpha (opacity) values in the mask or in the background will be ignored.
        Parameters:
        image - The source Image object to apply the mask to.
        colorBgnd - An optional background Color object for smaller sized masks. If it is null then RGB white (#ffffff) is used.
        imageMask - The mask Image object. Preferably in black and white or greyscale.
        Returns:
        The masked Image object.

      • createPlainImage

        public static javafx.scene.image.WritableImage createPlainImage(double dWidth,
                                                                double dHeight,
                                                                javafx.scene.paint.Color colorBgnd)
        Creates a plain colored WritableImage of the given dimensions.
        Parameters:
        dWidth - The desired width.
        dHeight - The desired height.
        colorBgnd - The background color to use. If it is null then the default Color.BLACK is used by the system.
        Returns:
        A WritableImage object of the wanted size.

      • imageFromBitmap

        public static javafx.scene.image.Image imageFromBitmap(Bitmap32 bitmap)
        Creates an Image object from the given Bitmap32 object.
        Parameters:
        bitmap - The source bitmap object.
        Returns:
        An Image object of the same size.

      • bitmapFromImage

        public static Bitmap32 bitmapFromImage(javafx.scene.image.Image image)
        Creates a Bitmap32 object from a given Image object.
        Parameters:
        image - The source image.
        Returns:
        A Bitmap32 object of the same size.

      • bitmapFromImage

        public static Bitmap32 bitmapFromImage(javafx.scene.image.Image image,
                                       int nNewWidth,
                                       int nNewHeight)
        Creates a Bitmap32 object from a given Image object and crops it centered to the given dimensions.
        Parameters:
        image - The source Image object.
        nNewWidth - The desired new width.
        nNewHeight - The desired new height.
        Returns:
        A Bitmap32 object with new dimensions.
